intro: Macrocarpaea polyantha, commonly known as the Hawaiian starflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. Macrocarpaea polyantha plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting various pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of the region.
